sel.world.chunk

Chunk's classes and various utilities.

License:
GNU General Lesser Public License v3

class Chunk;
Classic chunk with the size of 16 * 16.

final const pure nothrow @nogc @property @safe ChunkPosition position();
final const pure nothrow @nogc @property @safe int x();
final const pure nothrow @nogc @property @safe int z();
Returns the position of the chunk in the world.

final pure nothrow @nogc @property @safe World world();
Gets the chunk's world.

final pure nothrow @nogc @property @safe BlockStorage blocks();
Gets the world's blocks

Block* opIndex(BlockPosition position);
Block* opIndex(ubyte x, size_t y, ubyte z);
Gets a block in the chunk.

Params:
ubyte x x coordinates in range 0..16
size_t y y coordinate in range 0..HEIGHT
ubyte z z coordinate in range 0..16

Block* opIndexAssign(Block* block, BlockPosition position);
Block* opIndexAssign(block_t block, BlockPosition position);
Block* opIndexAssign(Block* block, ubyte x, uint y, ubyte z);
Block* opIndexAssign(block_t block, ubyte x, uint y, ubyte z);
Sets a block in the chunk.

Params:
Block* block the block to be set
ubyte x x coordinates in range 0..16
uint y y coordinate in range 0..HEIGHT
ubyte z z coordinate in range 0..16

@safe void registerTile(T)(T tile) if (is(T : Tile) && is(T : Block));
Registers a tile.

@safe T tileAt(T)(BlockPosition position);
Gets a tile.

ptrdiff_t firstBlock(ubyte x, ubyte z);
Gets the y position of the first non-air block from top.

Returns:
the y position of the block or -1

Example:
if(chunk.firstBlock(12, 9) == -1) {
   d("The column is air-only");
}


bool emptySection(size_t y);
Checks whether or not a section is empty (has no blocks in it).

bool tickSection(size_t y);
Checks if a section contains blocks with the random tick.

Section sectionAt(size_t y);
Section opIndex(size_t y);
Gets a section.

final pure nothrow @nogc @property @safe Section[size_t] sections();
Gets the sections.

final pure nothrow @nogc @property @safe bool empty();
Checks whether or not the chunks is air.

@property @safe Vector2!ubyte nextSnow();
Gets or generate the position for the next block where the snow should fall.

@safe void resetSnow();
Resets the snow

void unload();
Unloads a chunks and frees its memory
